description.narrative:
Theory of Change:
This project falls under the thematic area of Right to Food. Through our work, Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more small-scale food producers and agricultural workers, particularly women and their communities, benefit fromlocal to global public and private sector policies that protect and promote their prosperity and resilience.
Within this Theory of Change, this project in Vietnam has set the following impact and objective: # The project#s Impact: Women, men, and children escape poverty andinjustice through realizing their right to food. # The project#s long-term outcome: Small-scale food producers (women and men) benefit from the support of improved local, national and global civil society, government, and businesspolicies that promote their prosperity and resilience, and so have sustainable access to land, water, and markets.
In general terms a description of the strategies that we apply to achieve our long term outcome: - Strengthened CSOs: Capacity buildingand Civil society space - Policy change (Government and Private sector): research, lobby, influencing activities - Increased citizen's voice - "Stronger and wider alliances" is also a part of the Oxfam country strategy in Vietnam. It is a cross-cuttingtheme in this proposal, through capacity building for multi-stakeholder coalitions, linkages to receptive government policy-makers and business actors, and in strengthening citizen voice through media and other forms of influencing.
To achieve thislong-term outcome in Vietnam, Oxfam works together with the following partners: - Warecord, spark, Cecem, Verp, VIFEP, CECR, An Giang University , Cird

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

legacy-data.name: project-name
legacy-data.value: Oxfam in Vietnam Support Right to Food

description.narrative: Improved policies Private Sector: # cases where Oxfam Novib’s/partners influencing has contributed to private sector actors adopting/implementing gender sensitive policies promoting climate change resilient farming systems and/or genetic diversity.
